meanings.definition: A constitutional right to reject a decision or proposal made by a law-making body.
meanings.sent1: The president used his veto to stop the new law.
meanings.sent2: The veto by the governor halted the bill from becoming law.
meanings.sent3: The veto by the mayor saved the town from a costly mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her veto was like a shield protecting the citizens' rights.
meanings.sent5: The veto stood as a powerful tool in the hands of the leader.

meanings.definition: To reject or prohibit a decision or proposal made by a law-making body.
meanings.sent1: The committee decided to veto the unpopular bill.
meanings.sent2: He will veto any changes that go against the original plan.
meanings.sent3: She had to veto the idea of having a pizza party at the library.
meanings.sent4: His decision to veto the merger surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The coach had to veto the risky play to ensure the team's safety.

meanings.definition: The power to prevent something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's veto over disasters saved the city many times.
meanings.sent2: The veto of the storm's arrival brought relief to the residents.
meanings.sent3: The cat's veto over the mouse's escape plan was swift and effective.
meanings.sent4: His veto over the project's failure was a testament to his leadership.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's veto over chaos in the classroom restored order instantly.
